0: {"Space": {"Var1":{"short_description":"Temperature", "data_type": "float", "initial_value": 25},"Var2":{"short_description":"Rainfall", "data_type": "float", "initial_value": 10}}}Q:How can I get the index of the first occurrence of a character in a string?I have a string like this:var str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";And I want to find out which position it starts at. So if I wanted to find the index of the letter 'c', I would expect it to return 2. How do I go about doing this?A:You could use String#indexOf() method.const str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";console.log(str.indexOf('c')); // 2If you need to get the index of the first occurrence of c, you can use Array#findIndex():const str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";console.log(str.findIndex(char => char === 'c')); // 2A:You can use.indexOf() function.var str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";var result = str.indexOf("c");console.log(result);A:You can also use regular expressions to match your desired substring.var str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";var regex = /c/g;var matches = [];while ((matches = regex.exec(str))!== null) {      // Do something with `matches`}console.log(matches[0]);A:You can use the indexOf() method.var str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";var index = str.indexOf('c');alert(index);A:You can use the indexOf() method.var str = "abcdefghijklmnop
